answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some  documents that may help answer your question about Maintenance/Buildings & Grounds Departments.
The document entitled Building a Plan: What city and county managers’ need to know to create effective facilities maintenance and capital plan is about the best ways to request funds for building improvements.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/3675/Building_a_Plan_What_city_and_county_managers_neet_to_know_to_create_an_effective_facilities_mainten
I have also included an article about the 2004 Program Excellence Award Winner for Innovations in Local Government Management for their program which uses technology to make public works more efficient.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/1216/2004_Program_Excellence_Award_for_Innovations_in_Local_Government_Management_Integrated_Technology_S
The report below discusses how Durham, NC keeps their construction costs down for government buildings.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/2496/Controlling_Costs_in_a_Tight_Construction_Market
I also found the National Clearinghouse for Educational Facilities list of School Facilities Management Software. 
http://www.ncef.org/rl/software.cfm
Another report which might be helpful is the Texas Facilities Commission Maintenance Program Review which you can see below.
http://www.ccg.state.tx.us/documents/CCGFacilitiesReport.pdf
Also, I included the link to the Best Practices Maintenance Plan for School Buildings from the State of Idaho Department of Education.
http://www.sde.idaho.gov/site/facilities/docs/maintenance/MaintenancePlan.pdf
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo 
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

text:
